q: There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.
h:
“There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
h:
“Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.
h:
“Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
h:
“Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Do not bite at the bait of pleasure, till you know there is no hook beneath it.
h:
“Do not bite at the bait of pleasure, till you know there is no hook beneath it.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.
h:
“There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.” —
Colin Powell

q: The best way out is always through.
h:
“The best way out is always through.” —
Robert Frost

q: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.
h:
“I dream my painting and I paint my dream.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: A person who does not read is no better than one cannot read.
h:
“A person who does not read is no better than one cannot read.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: If no one ever broke the rules, then we'd never advance.
h:
“If no one ever broke the rules, then we'd never advance.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of your thoughts.
h:
“The quality of your life is determined by the quality of your thoughts.” —
Unknown

q: To raise your consciousness, surround yourself with people of higher consciousness.
h:
“To raise your consciousness, surround yourself with people of higher consciousness.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Change is never easy, but always possible.
h:
“Change is never easy, but always possible.” —
Barack Obama

q: People inspire you, or they drain you. Pick them wisely.
h:
“People inspire you, or they drain you. Pick them wisely.” —
Les Brown

q: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
h:
“If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.
h:
“Only he who has no use for the empire is fit to be entrusted with it.” —
Zhuangzi

q: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
h:
“The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
h:
“Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow. ” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing.
h:
“When you reach the top of the mountain, keep climbing. ” —
Zen Proverb

q: Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.
h:
“Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance
h:
“Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance” —
Honore de Balzac

q: The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.
h:
“The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
h:
“Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.” —
Stephen King

q: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
h:
“Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:
“The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
h:
“The most effective way to do it, is to do it.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.
h:
“If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Ponder and deliberate before you make a move.
h:
“Ponder and deliberate before you make a move.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Open your eyes and look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
h:
“Open your eyes and look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?” —
Bob Marley

q: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.
h:
“To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.” —
Pema Chodron

q: It is what we make out of what we have, not what we are given, that separates one person from another.
h:
“It is what we make out of what we have, not what we are given, that separates one person from another.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality.
h:
“Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
h:
“Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.
h:
“Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.” —
Robert Greene

q: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
h:
“Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
h:
“Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
h:
“Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The more knowledge you have, the more you're free to rely on your instincts.
h:
“The more knowledge you have, the more you're free to rely on your instincts.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
h:
“A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
h:
“You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do. ” —
Henry Ford

q: If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
h:
“If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.
h:
“The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.” —
Unknown

q: Don't be afraid to see what you see.
h:
“Don't be afraid to see what you see.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
h:
“Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
h:
“The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.
h:
“The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The single most powerful asset we all have is our mind.
h:
“The single most powerful asset we all have is our mind.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.
h:
“The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.” —
Simon Sinek
